channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16375] Mapreduce mini cluster using HBaseTestingUtility not setting correct resourcemanager and jobhistory webapp address of MapReduceTestingShim
item.description:
Starting mapreduce mini cluster using HBaseTestingUtility is not setting "yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address" and "mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address" which are required for getting the submitted yarn apps using mapreduce webapp. These properties are not being copied from jobConf of MapReduceTestingShim resulting in default values.

HBaseTestingUtility.java
// Allow the user to override FS URI for this map-reduce cluster to use.
mrCluster = new MiniMRCluster(servers,
FS_URI != null ? FS_URI : FileSystem.get(conf).getUri().toString(), 1,
null, null, new JobConf(this.conf));
JobConf jobConf = MapreduceTestingShim.getJobConf(mrCluster);
if (jobConf == null)

Unknown macro: { jobConf = mrCluster.createJobConf(); }

jobConf.set("mapreduce.cluster.local.dir",
conf.get("mapreduce.cluster.local.dir")); //Hadoop MiniMR overwrites this while it should not
LOG.info("Mini mapreduce cluster started");

// In hadoop2, YARN/MR2 starts a mini cluster with its own conf instance and updates settings.
// Our HBase MR jobs need several of these settings in order to properly run. So we copy the
// necessary config properties here. YARN-129 required adding a few properties.
conf.set("mapreduce.jobtracker.address", jobConf.get("mapreduce.jobtracker.address"));
// this for mrv2 support; mr1 ignores this
conf.set("mapreduce.framework.name", "yarn");
conf.setBoolean("yarn.is.minicluster", true);
String rmAddress = jobConf.get("yarn.resourcemanager.address");
if (rmAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("yarn.resourcemanager.address", rmAddress); }

String historyAddress = jobConf.get("mapreduce.jobhistory.address");
if (historyAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("mapreduce.jobhistory.address", historyAddress); }

String schedulerAddress =
jobConf.get("yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.address");
if (schedulerAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.address", schedulerAddress); }

As a immediate fix for phoenix e2e test to succeed, need the below lines to be added as well

String rmWebappAddress = jobConf.get("yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address");
if (rmWebappAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address", rmWebappAddress); }

String historyWebappAddress = jobConf.get("mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address");
if (historyWebappAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address", historyWebappAddress); }

Eventually, we should also see if we can copy over all the jobConf properties to HBaseTestingUtility conf object.
item.summary: Mapreduce mini cluster using HBaseTestingUtility not setting correct resourcemanager and jobhistory webapp address of MapReduceTestingShim

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Attached a patch which has to go in release 0.98 and higher. Kindly review and let me know in case of any modifications.

Sean Busbey Andrew Purtell larsh

+1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Can you confirm wether or not this impacts the 1.1 and 0.98 lines?
Could you add a simple test job that tries to make use of the mapreduce mini cluster that fails without the change?

Just came to know that this change is required for both 1.1 and 0.98 as well. Please push the changes to 0.98 and above.

CC: James Taylor

The actual test resides in phoenix which utilises the added configuration for e2e test of async secondary index which uses RM resource manager web address.

I am not sure if we need any tests to be added for this in HBase. If needed, please let me know which test to be replicated in hbase test suite.

The actual test resides in phoenix which utilises the added configuration for e2e test of async secondary index which uses RM resource manager web address.

I'm unsure if you're saying this is actually a bug in how HBase handles the configs from the MiniCluster instances managed by HBTU or if instead it's an Apache Phoenix test presuming access to some internals that aren't exposed.

I am not sure if we need any tests to be added for this in HBase. If needed, please let me know which test to be replicated in hbase test suite.

Presuming this is HBTU behaving incorrectly by failing to include required configs, I'd say we need a test added in hbase to ensure we keep doing the correct thing. Reproducing an Apache Phoenix test is overkill for this; we need only ensure that we have the expected configs after standing up an HBTU instance.
also, please don't edit comments in a way that changes their meaning (like revising the initial comment from "1.2 and higher" to "0.98 and higher").
Sure.

I'm unsure if you're saying this is actually a bug in how HBase handles the configs from the MiniCluster instances managed by HBTU or if instead it's an Apache Phoenix test presuming access to some internals that aren't exposed.

Newly added Apache phoenix test needs the configs which aren't exposed from HBTU.

The change seems ok to me, no less magic than other YARN / MR config wrangling.

I'd say we need a test added in hbase to ensure we keep doing the correct thing

Agreed, as long as the test doesn't cause more trouble than it's worth. We compile HBase 0.98 by default with Hadoop 2.2.0. Meanwhile trunk requires Hadoop 2.7.1. Can a test cover correct MR job submission through all of those different versions?

Can a test cover correct MR job submission through all of those different versions?

Does the test need to actually submit a job? Doesn't it just need to get an HBTU instance configured for MR and then examine the Configuration returned from getConfiguration?

I think we already have test(s) that cover job submission and AFAICT these configs won't impact any such test jobs.

-1 overall

Ok, sure, getting a JobConf and examining settings we want will be compatible across all those versions.
Although those settings won't apply to all of those versions... We can aim for a union of settings that works from 2.2 to 2.7
FYI- Just verified, the mapred and yarn configs added to HBTU as part of this JIRA are supported in hadoop 2.2 and above.

Sean Busbey Andrew Purtell I see that there is TestHBaseTestingUtility.java. However there are no tests which are written specially to check the conf being set already.

String rmAddress = jobConf.get("yarn.resourcemanager.address");
if (rmAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("yarn.resourcemanager.address", rmAddress); }

String historyAddress = jobConf.get("mapreduce.jobhistory.address");
if (historyAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("mapreduce.jobhistory.address", historyAddress); }

String schedulerAddress =
jobConf.get("yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.address");
if (schedulerAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { conf.set("yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.address", schedulerAddress); }

newly added configs

String mrJobHistoryWebappAddress =
+ jobConf.get("mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address");
+ if (mrJobHistoryWebappAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { + conf.set("mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address", mrJobHistoryWebappAddress); + }

+ String yarnRMWebappAddress =
+ jobConf.get("yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address");
+ if (yarnRMWebappAddress != null)

Unknown macro: { + conf.set("yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address", yarnRMWebappAddress); + }

If we need code coverage test on the configs, then we need to write a unit test that starts mini mapreduce cluster and verifies that the jobConf from MapReduceTestingShim are being populated to instance variable "conf" of HBaseTestingUtility.

Are we looking for such a test to be added here (to cover existing and newly added configs)?

I am looking for such a test, though I only care about it covering the newly added configs. A follow-on JIRA that makes note of a need to test the other configs would be nice, but isn't strictly needed as far as I'm concerned.
Added the test and attached the patch. Please review.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Attached the patch using --format-patch. In this case, the single patch was applying to master branch as well. So, not attaching multiple patches.

The latest patch is not correctly named. See the guide Sean provided a link to. To submit and test for master branch, name the patch HBASE-16375.patch. Because you included the string "0.98" it will be tested against 0.98 which is not what we want.

I have created and attached HBASE-16375.master.001.patch for master branch. Do i need to create separate patches for all the branches > 0.98? Is there any way where the same patch gets applied to all branches > 0.98?

Correct, you'd need to make a patch per branch. However in this case I think it's fine to just put up a patch just for master. Precommit results will generally apply and the committer can easily run the new test when applying the patch to the other target branches to check there is not unexpected variation

-1 overall

Test failure is unrelated. Going to commit shortly.

I'm going to modify this patch slightly. On branch-1 and below I'm seeing failures due to missing jsr305 annotations for Configuration due to the new test. (OpenJDK 7u111) If I change the test to use HBaseTestingUtility's getConfiguration method to access the configuration object there's no problem. Interestingly this does not manifest on master branch. I will come back to this later in the context of the change that banned jsr305.
Pushed
Attaching what I committed as 'HBASE-16375.patch'
